metadata.title: CVE-2014-1584 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The Public Key Pinning (PKP) implementation in Mozilla Firefox before 33.0skips pinning checks upon an unspecified issuer-verification error, whichmakes it easier for remote attackers to bypass an intended pinningconfiguration and spoof a web site via a crafted certificate that leads topresentation of the Untrusted Connection dialog to the user.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1584` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
